poem:
**Silent Revolutions**

In the cold hush of morning, whispers  
of warmth slip through fingers like subsidies,  
unfurled promises curling into forgotten  
corners. Reeves shuffles the cards—who deals  
when the deck is stacked? Homes hold  
their breath; reforms echo in radiators'  
hollow cores. Winter waits with patience,  
testing drafts against walls as citizens,  
gather wool and silence in equal measure.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hundreds of thousands to lose heat pump subsidies in Reeves’s budget plan Hundreds of thousands of homeowners will lose their right to subsidies for eco-friendly heat pumps as a result of government plans to bring down energy bills at the budget. Rachel Reeves, the chancellor, is planning to announce a series of measures to bring down energy bills amid concerns the country’s stubbornly high cost of living is driving millions of voters to Reform UK.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
